meanings.sent1: I found a mickey of whiskey in the cabinet.
meanings.sent2: The bartender poured a shot from the mickey of vodka.
meanings.sent3: At the party, someone brought a mickey of rum as a gift.
meanings.sent4: The mickey of tequila hit me harder than I expected.
meanings.sent5: The mickey of gin was so tiny, it looked like a toy bottle.

meanings.definition: A type of prank or practical joke
meanings.sent1: Tommy played a mickey on his sister by hiding her toy.
meanings.sent2: The class clown pulled a mickey on the teacher by switching the chairs.
meanings.sent3: The mickey they pulled on me was actually quite funny.
meanings.sent4: Their prank was a real mickey that caught everyone off guard.
meanings.sent5: The mickey they planned was so clever, it made everyone laugh.

meanings.sent1: I need to buy a new mickey for my laptop.
meanings.sent2: The wireless mickey makes it easier to navigate the screen.
meanings.sent3: The mickey on my computer stopped working, so I had to use the touchpad.
meanings.sent4: The mickey with extra buttons helped me work faster.
meanings.sent5: The mickey with the red light looked cool on the desk.

meanings.definition: A type of drug cocktail used to incapacitate someone
meanings.sent1: The criminal used a mickey to drug his victim.
meanings.sent2: The detective found evidence of a mickey in the suspect's bag.
meanings.sent3: The mickey they used in the movie plot was quite elaborate.
meanings.sent4: The villain's plan involved slipping a mickey into the hero's drink.
meanings.sent5: The spy had to be careful not to fall for the enemy's mickey.
